title.narrative: Northern Volta Agroforestry, Bee and Micro Livestock Project (NOVABEEM)

description.narrative: This is a composite project consisting of four communities in the northern part of the Volta region. Two of these communities are in the Hohoe district while the other two are in the Jasikan district. The project will assist 100 families, in addition to 100 pass-on families, with beehives and beekeeping equipment, local poultry, and tree nurseries from which timber and other economic tree seedlings would be produced for sale to the Forestry Department as well as for use by the project beneficiaries. Two existing group fishponds would be rehabilitated and through the sale of fish the financial sustainability of the project would be assured. The project beneficiaries will also receive technical training in beekeeping, poultry production, agro- forestry, aquaculture, eco-tourism, gender equity and HIV/AIDS. The project beneficiaries are subsistence farmers engaging mainly in cassava and maize cultivation using “slash and burn” methods. Due to increased population pressure on land, the traditional land fallow period has reduced considerably leading to soil erosion and low crop yields. This, alongside erratic and sometimes insufficient precipitation, has created food insecurity problems thereby affecting livelihoods. This project would therefore address food deficit and environmental issues through capacity building in regenerative agricultural methods and diversification of income producing activities.

"Theoretical and hands-on training in Beekeeping, grasscutter management and and poultry production. Training in project management and record keeping.Training in compost preparation. Training on leadership skills development. Training on the 12 HPI cornerstones. Training on gender equity. HIV/AIDS awareness creation. Farmer to farmer visitation."
